Articles.Content:
I've been trying to get this Mod to work on my latest KSP adventures so that I could look at some shiny clouds.

But for some reason the clouds don't load into the game.

I've tried to get some information on what I'm doing wrong but without a FAQ on the first post it's rather hard to see if anybody else even had the same problem. (meaning that I'm not smart enough to install this for some reason)

Regards Xelon
Getting this bug after installing:

Getting this bug after installing:

http://i.imgur.com/PCCRvQX.png

Use the low-res. Looks like your machine (os or hardware) can't handle the 8k graphics.
Okay... It still makes the game crash, I have the Texture Compressor, and I've reinstalled twice. Still nothing.

Okay... It still makes the game crash, I have the Texture Compressor, and I've reinstalled twice. Still nothing.

Hmmm... post the KSP.log file so I can see what is going on...
And how do I do that?

And how do I do that?

in the KSP folder, there is a KSP.log file. Upload that somewhere (dropbox, google docs, mediafire, etc. ) so I can take a look.
Here it is.https://drive.google.com/?urp=http://www.google.com/url?sa%3Dt%26rct%3Dj%26q%3D%26esrc%3Ds%26sou&pli=1&authuser=0#my-drive

Here it is.https://drive.google.com/?urp=http://www.google.com/url?sa%3Dt%26rct%3Dj%26q%3D%26esrc%3Ds%26sou&pli=1&authuser=0#my-drive

Ummm... you have to post the link of the item. Right click the item -> share -> share; Then change access to "anyone who has the link" and post the link that is in the popup here.
Should work now.

Should work now.

You still have to post the correct link to the file. When I click on that, it just brings me to MY google drive folder.
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mJRAMg16osvAV3W8Mk0qBfJ79IGhS13dw47nuLxjMLk/edit Here.

From the log:

DynamicHeapAllocator out of memory - Could not get memory for large allocationCould not allocate memory: System out of memory!

Trying to allocate: 178956972B with 4 alignment. MemoryLabel: DynamicArray

Allocation happend at: Line:318 in

Memory overview

[ ALLOC_TEMP_THREAD ] used: 30736B | peak: 0B | reserved: 65536B

[ ALLOC_DEFAULT ] used: 95056104B | peak: 0B | reserved: 103452277B

[ ALLOC_GFX ] used: 36482772B | peak: 0B | reserved: 52501936B

[ ALLOC_CACHEOBJECTS ] used: 1424B | peak: 0B | reserved: 2097152B

[ ALLOC_TYPETREE ] used: 0B | peak: 0B | reserved: 0B

[ ALLOC_PROFILER ] used: 154512B | peak: 0B | reserved: 4194304B

Could not allocate memory: System out of memory!

Looks like you are running out of memory. Looks like TextureCompressor isn't installed. Install that, and see if it works. Note that if you are on mac, you have to MERGE the BoulderCo folders. Don't over-write.
I am unsure on how to install it. Instructions unclear. I put the files in the BoulderCo folder. Or is that not how you install it?

I am unsure on how to install it. Instructions unclear. I put the files in the BoulderCo folder. Or is that not how you install it?

The directory structure should end up looking something like:

KSP/GameData/BoulderCo/...

where BoulderCo has CityLights, Clouds, Plugins and textureCompressorConfigs as subfolders once both VisualEnhancements and textureCompressor are installed.
What about textureCompressorCache?

What about textureCompressorCache?

That is a generated directory. it will appear in BoulderCo after running.
Did everything correctly. Still crashing.

Did everything correctly. Still crashing.

How about a new logfile? Now that textureCompressor should be in there?

How about a new logfile? Now that textureCompressor should be in there?
It's the same thing. I think I did something incorrectly.

I'm getting a very weird bug where any body (Kerbin or Mun) has what looks like weird waves on them, it's hard to explain. I uploaded a video of it on YouTube but it says pending, not sure where else I can upload it to in order to show you. Any suggestions?

I'm getting a very weird bug where any body (Kerbin or Mun) has what looks like weird waves on them, it's hard to explain. I uploaded a video of it on YouTube but it says pending, not sure where else I can upload it to in order to show you. Any suggestions?

I've never seen anything like that before...

I'm getting a very weird bug where any body (Kerbin or Mun) has what looks like weird waves on them, it's hard to explain. I uploaded a video of it on YouTube but it says pending, not sure where else I can upload it to in order to show you. Any suggestions?

You should post a link to that video. Eventually it'll stop pending and be viewable.

What happens when I have two cloudLayers/userCloudLayers? Im using both the Urania planet pack and Alternis. And they each have their set of clouds with with their own layers file. Ive been just overwriting them until now. Something tells me that's not right..
motokid they will conflict onlny have one of each. should be 2 cloud.cfg one is default other is user
